8 Poin Keberatan RUU Perlindungan Data Pribadi
01 Nov 2019, 14:58 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi. (Foto: CNN Indonesia/Hani Nur Fajrina)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Plt Kepala Biro Humas Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika (Kemenkominfo) Ferdinandus Setu mengatakan ada delapan poin yang menjadi alasan Rancangan Undang-Undang Perlindungan Data Pribadi (RUU PDP) dikembalikan oleh Kementerian Sekretariat Negara.Pria yang kerap disapa Nando itu mengatakan RUU PDP dikembalikan ke Kemenkominfo atas permintaan Kementerian Dalam Negeri dan Kejaksaan Tinggi. Pihaknya telah menerima RUU PDP pada Senin, 14 Oktober 2019."Pengembalian RUU PDP atas permintaan Kemendagri dan Kejaksaan Agung. Dikembalikan tanggal 14 Oktober 2019 kemarin," kata Ferdinandus kepada awak media usai konferensi pers di Gedung Kemenkominfo, Jakarta, Senin (28/10).Nando mengatakan ada delapan poin RUU PDP yang menjadi alasan Setneg mengembalikannya ke Kemenkominfo. Kedelapan poin tersebut antara lain:1. Pasal 7 soal hak memiliki data pribadi.2. Pasal 20 soal permintaan data pribadi.3. Pasal 1 angka 7 soal definisi korporasi.4. Pasal 10 soal hak untuk mengajukan keberatan.5. Pasal 17 ayat 2 huruf a mengenai prinsip PDP.6. Pengecualian alat pemroses atau pengolah data visual.7. Pengecualian kewajiban pengendalian PDP.8. Perlu dipertimbangkan bahwa RUU ini mengatur alat bukti yang sah, termasuk alat elektronik.Menkominfo Johnny G. Plate pun mengatakan bahwa Kemendagri dan Kejaksaan Tinggi masih 'keberatan' dengan draf RUU PDP, salah satu poinnya ialah soal sanksi administratif."Yang masih keberatan dengan draf RUU PDP adalah Kemendagri dan Kejaksaan Tinggi, salah satu poin yang menurut mereka perlu dibahas lebih lanjut adalah sanksi administratif," tuturnya.Sebelumnya, Direktur Jenderal Aplikasi Informatika Kementerian Komunikasi dan Informatika (Dirjen Aptika Kemenkominfo), Semuel Abrijani Pangerapan mengatakan draf RUU PDP memang sudah siap dan telah dibahas oleh pemerintah.Sehingga, RUU ini bisa langsung diserahkan ke DPR begitu lembaga legislasi itu menggelar program legislasi nasional (Prolegnas). RUU ini tak masuk dalam prolegnas periode sebelumnya karena saat itu masih dalam tahap sinkronisasi dengan perundangan lain di Sekretariat Negara. (din/evn)

8 Points of Objection on the Personal Data Protection Bill
01 Nov 2019, 14:58 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration. (Photo: CNN Indonesia / Hani Nur Fajrina)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Acting Head of the Public Relations Bureau of the Ministry of Communication and Information (Kemenkominfo) Ferdinandus Setu said there were eight points that became the reason for the Draft of Personal Data Protection Bill (RUU PDP) returned by the Ministry of State Secretariat. The man who is often called Nando said that The PDP Bill was returned to the Ministry of Communication and Information at the request of the Ministry of Home Affairs and the High Prosecutors Office. He said he had received the PDP bill on Monday, October 14, 2019. "The return of the PDP bill at the request of the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Attorney General's Office. Returned on October 14, 2019 yesterday," Ferdinandus told the media crew after a press conference at the Kemenkominfo Building, Jakarta, Monday (10/28) ). Nando said that there were eight points of the PDP Bill which became the reason for the State Secretariat to return it to the Ministry of Communication and Information. The eight points include: 1. Article 7 about the right to own personal data.2. Article 20 about requests for personal data. Article 1 number 7 about the definition of corporation.4. Article 10 concerning the right to submit an objection. Article 17 paragraph 2 letter a regarding the PDP principle.6. Exceptions to visual data processing or processing tools.7. Exception PDP control obligations.8. It should be considered that this bill regulates legal evidence, including electronic devices. Minister of Communication and Information Johnny G. Plate also said that the Ministry of Home Affairs and the High Prosecutor's Office still 'objected' to the draft PDP Bill, one of the points was the matter of administrative sanctions. The PDP Bill is the Ministry of Home Affairs and the High Prosecutors Office, one of the points that they think needs to be further discussed is administrative sanctions, "he said. ready and has been discussed by the government. Thus, this bill can be directly submitted to the DPR once the legislative body holds a national legislation program (Prolegnas). This bill was not included in the previous period's prolegnas because at that time it was still in the stage of synchronizing with other laws in the State Secretariat. (din / evn)
